content.question: Problem 2. Consider the function $f(x) = \begin{cases} \sin(x) & \text{if } x < 0 \\ ax + b & \text{if } 0 \leq x < 1 \\ \frac{1}{2}x^2 + \frac{1}{2} & \text{if } x \geq 1 \end{cases}$, where $a$ and $b$ are real numbers.

subquestions.question: 2.a) For what value of $a$ and what value of $b$ is $f$ continuous at every point in its domain?
subquestions.answer: For $f$ to be continuous at every point, we require: $a = 2$ and $b = \frac{1}{2}$.

subquestions.question: 2.b) For the values of $a$ and $b$ found in 2.a), at which values of $x$ is $f$ differentiable?
subquestions.answer: For $f$ to be differentiable, the only value of $x$ at which $f$ may not be differentiable is $x = 1$. Upon verification, $f$ is differentiable at $x = 1$ for $a = 2$ and $b = \frac{1}{2}$. Therefore, $f$ is differentiable on $(-\infty, \infty)$.

subquestions.question: 2.c) For the values of $a$ and $b$ found in 2.a), write an expression for $f'(x)$ on the domain found in part 2.b).
subquestions.answer: For $f$ differentiable on $(-\infty, \infty)$, we have: $f'(x) = \begin{cases} \cos(x) & \text{if } x < 0 \\ 2 & \text{if } 0 \leq x < 1 \\ 2x & \text{if } x \geq 1 \end{cases}$.
